articles.title: Newly Discovered Bone Stem Cell Causes Premature Skull Fusion - Technology Networks
articles.description: A previously unknown type of bone-forming stem cell causes premature fusion of the top of the skull in infants, reports a new study.
articles.content: Craniosynostosis, the premature fusion of the top of the skull in infants, is caused by an abnormal excess of a previously unknown type of bone-forming stem cell, according to a preclinical study led… [+5067 chars]

articles.title: Genetically modified silkworms produced spider silk six times tougher than the Kevlar - Tech Explorist
